1 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
2 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
40 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 78 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 154 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
193 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 231 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

307 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
346 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 384 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 460 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
499 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 537 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 613 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
652 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 690 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. 766 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
805 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 843 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 919 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
996 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1034 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1072 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1110 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1148 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1186 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1224 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1262 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1300 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1338 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1376 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1414 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1452 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1490 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1528 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 1566 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1604 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1642 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1680 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1718 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1756 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1794 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1832 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1870 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
1908 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

1984 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
2023 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2061 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2099 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2137 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
2175 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2213 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
2251 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2289 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2327 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2365 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2403 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

2441 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2479 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2517 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2555 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2593 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2631 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
2669 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2707 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2745 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2783 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2821 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2859 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

2897 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met.
