2935 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 2973 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
3011 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3049 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3087 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3125 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
3163 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
3201 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3239 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3277 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3315 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3353 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
3391 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3429 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3467 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3505 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3543 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3581 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3619 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3657 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3695 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3733 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3771 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
3809 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3847 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3885 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3923 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 3961 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
3999 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. 4037 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.

The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review. 
4075 JHM IRB review of research involving unlicensed or unapproved drugs, botanicals, biologicals, or other substances (e.g., food additives, food derivatives, vitamins, minerals, extracts, etc.) must be conducted at a convened meeting. The review must include the presence of a P&T IRB member who will make a recommendation concerning the risks and proposed benefits of each product to be used in the study. The IRB review will address the need for submission of an FDA Investigational New Drug Application (IND) prior to the use of the test article in the research study. The IRB may determine that an IND is not required if all the conditions set forth in 21 CFR 312.2(b) have been met. The IRB will determine whether to require submission of an IND, or if appropriate, to require the Primary Investigator (PI) to seek clarification from the FDA about the need for obtaining an IND before the IRB completes its review.
